fullProgramDescription: The Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering offers a comprehensive undergraduate program leading to a Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering. The program includes coursework in mechanical systems, thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, materials science, and mathematics, as well as laboratory and design experiences.
shortProgramDescription: The Mechanical Engineering B.S. program at UC San Diego covers fundamental principles, experimental techniques, and design methodologies, preparing students for careers or graduate study.
classHighlights: The lower-division coursework includes calculus, physics, chemistry, and introductory engineering courses, providing a foundation for upper-division study.
Upper-division courses cover mechanical systems, thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, materials science, and mathematics, with laboratory and design components.
Students also complete a series of technical electives, allowing them to specialize in areas such as aerospace engineering, biomechanical engineering, or energy systems.
The program includes a strong emphasis on hands-on learning, with laboratory courses and design projects that simulate real-world engineering challenges.
The curriculum is designed to meet the needs of students who plan to pursue a career in industry or continue their education at the graduate level.
learningOutcomes: Apply fundamental principles of mechanical engineering to solve problems.
Design and conduct experiments, as well as analyze and interpret data.
Develop and implement designs that meet specific requirements.
Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences.
Work effectively in teams to achieve common goals.
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in mechanical engineering.
creditRequirements: total of around180-200 units; MAE major prep and major require specific courses and52 upper-division units
additionalInformation: The MAE department offers advising and research opportunities. Students are encouraged to participate in internships and research projects to gain practical experience.
